snippet: As Moscow ordered more military exercises on Ukraine’s border, Secretary of State John Kerry met the Russian foreign minister but failed to find a solution.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry fails in 11th-hour bid to ease escalating crisis over Russia's intervention in Crimea, raising likelihood of sanctions and deepening worst rift between countries since Cold War; Russian Foreign Min Sergey V Lavrov appears to have little or no leeway to negotiate, highlighting Pres Vladimir V Putin's determination that Crimea should proceed with secession vote.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and STEVEN LEE MYERS
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from London and Steven Lee Myers from Moscow. Reporting was contributed by Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Alan Cowell from London, Peter Baker from Washington and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: As Moscow ordered more military exercises on Ukraine’s border, Secretary of State John Kerry met the Russian foreign minister but failed to find a solution.

headline.main: U.S.-Russia Talks on Ukraine Fail to Ease Tension
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Russia Talks on Ukraine Fail to Ease Tension
